result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kendall Quamane Love

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kendall Quamane Love not in Court, in custody.  Attorney Richard L. Voss Mr. appeared by video for Kendall Quamane Love.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference with Defendant's other Case, 22CF2000, and Co-Defendant Case, 22CF1690. Clerk previously made arrangements for Defendant to appear via Zoom from CJF; however, CJF did not have staff available to accommodate Court's request. Defendant's appearance waived for today's hearing. Court reviewed State's Motion for Joinder, Defense counsel's Brief in Opposition of State's Motion for Joinder, and Defense counsel's Motion to Allow Denny-Type Evidence at Trial. Defendant's appearance waived for today's hearing. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court of trial posture. Arguments heard regarding Motions. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED Defense counsel's Motion to Allow Denny-Type Evidence at Trial; and Court WITHHELD RULING on State's Joinder Motion. At this time, Mr. Love's cases (22CF1689 and 22CF2000) and Mr. Johnson's cases (22CF1690 and 22CF1999) will be set for trial on the same date. 

Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. 

Final PreTrial scheduled for January 12, 2023 at 02:00 pm. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. 
Jury Trial scheduled for February 27, 2023 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
Defense Motion to Allow Denny-Type Evidence at Trial; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
Defendant Love's Brief in Opposition of State's Motion for Joinder; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.
State's Joinder Motion. 2CF1689, 22CF1690, 22CF1999, 22CF2000; received, filed, and forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant Kendall Quamane Love appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Richard L. Voss Mr. in Court for Kendall Quamane Love.  Attorney Owen M Piotrowski appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Status hearing with Defendant's other Case, 22CF2000, and Co-Defendant Case, 22CF1690. Discussion placed on the record. Defense advised the Court of trial posture. State advised the Court of MOTION TO JOIN ALL CASES. Defense objected. Court ordered State's Motion due on or before October 7, 2022; and Defense counsel's Response due on or before October 21, 2022. Case adjourned for Scheduling Conference, Branch 46. 
Scheduling Conference scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 10:15 am. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Kendall Quamane Love in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Kendall Quamane Love in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference with Defendant's other case 22CF2000, and Co-Defendant's cases 22CF1999 and 22CF1690. Defendant and Attorney Voss appeared Via Zoom Video Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received partial discovery material from the State. State confirmed. Court addressed Defendant's Revocation. For reasons stated on the record, State requests a Status hearing. Court ordered case adjourned for Status hearing. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Status hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 10:30 am. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference

Clerk contacted the parties via email to reschedule Status/Scheduling Conference. 
NEW DATE: Status/Scheduling Conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 11:25 am. 
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.
Clerk provided information to MCSO.

Defendant Kendall Quamane Love in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Kendall Quamane Love in custody.  Owen M Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Defendant also has case 22CF2000. Discussion placed on the record. Defense counsel has NOT received complete discovery material or an offer from the State. State confirmed. Defense counsel requested a Scheduling Conference to allow time to review discovery material and offer. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Scheduling Conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 1:30pm. Defendant will appear via Zoom Video Conference. Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Defendant Kendall Quamane Love in court with Attorney Richard L. Voss; both appear by video.  Defendant Kendall Quamane Love in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 17CF4598. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective N. Reaves. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Kendall Quamane Love
Current: 3913 North 26th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206   (Effective: 05-03-2022)
Prior: 3941 North 24th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Defendant Kendall Quamane Love in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Defendant Kendall Quamane Love in custody.  Mallory R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Kendall Quamane Love appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
